page.title: 16MY VISIT TO CHERINGTON LAKE
page.content:
When you go along the road beside the lake, it seems as if it weren't (sic) there because it is in a sort of valley surrounded by trees of different kinds. When you get to the lake, there is a rocky bank which is different from the one on the other side, which is a large grassy one. In the middle of the lake there is a small island with a few trees on it. Sometimes there are swans and ducks on the lake. One bit of the lake has got lots of reeds growing, which makes it a sheltered area for the birds. At first the lake is quite shallow but it soon gets deeper. There are lots of fish in the lake, mostly trout. Although the lake looks safe, it can be dangerous because of the soft sand.
{KERRY MOORE, aged 9 {
